Posts.Content: On 1/1/2007 Mittmool wrote:   On 12/7/2006 Hana24 wrote: My mom has had breast cancer for about 3 yrs now. She has gone through chemo and radiation. During chemo she had lost her hair and went through some depression. Also she has had some problems with her heart. B/C of her heart problems she had to stop chemo on and off. My biggest worry though is her Dr. thinks she might have another lump in her breast and if so what does that mean? I know it means the cancer has come back, but does she have to go through chemo again or does it mean she is going to DIE fro m this now? It worries me so much that im scared to find out the answer to this:( I cant sleep, eat or concentrate on anything. I cry evernite when im alone. My mom is the only parent I have, and i dont know what i would do w/ out her. Please, if anyone has anything to share with me i would be so grateful. Thank you     Finding a lump in your mother's breast does not necessarily mean that's it's cancerous.  Please don't think the worst, try to think a little more positive about your mother and her health status.  I'm sure your mother will be just fine, as long as she is following her doctors guidelines and implemening natural remedies she will recover and be back to normal.  I know the feeling where your scared and can't sleep, your mind wanders and you think the worst, but don't let fear win you over.  Pray and give it to God and empower yourself by listening to Adam on dreamhealer.com.  When you go into www.dreamhealer.com-Click on the page where Adam speaks on Live Radio about how our intentions influence our health and how we can heal ourselves with the right energy.  Adam is only 20 years old and has helped millions of people feel better, he has a DVD and many great books to help relieve fear and tension that we all go through when we hear that our loved ones are not doing well.  I'll be praying for your mom and you and wish you both the best.  Let me know how you make out with the web-site on Adam.
Posts.Title: i am so Scared For my Mom!!!

Posts.Content: On 12/7/2006 Hana24 wrote: My mom has had breast cancer for about 3 yrs now. She has gone through chemo and radiation. During chemo she had lost her hair and went through some depression. Also she has had some problems with her heart. B/C of her heart problems she had to stop chemo on and off. My biggest worry though is her Dr. thinks she might have another lump in her breast and if so what does that mean? I know it means the cancer has come back, but does she have to go through chemo again or does it mean she is going to DIE fro m this now? It worries me so much that im scared to find out the answer to this:( I cant sleep, eat or concentrate on anything. I cry evernite when im alone. My mom is the only parent I have, and i dont know what i would do w/ out her. Please, if anyone has anything to share with me i would be so grateful. Thank you
Posts.Title: i am so Scared For my Mom!!!

Posts.Content: On 6/23/2006 Teresa921 wrote: Hi Gary, I was diagnosed last Sept. with Hormone positive breast cancer. Against my doctor's advice, I chose not to have chemo or radiation or even lymph node removal. My doctor told me there was a 25% chance it would return in 2 years without the treatment. Well, that is a 75% chance in my favor! The cancer was 4 cm. and they said they had clear margins upon removal. I just had my 6 month check up and everything is going well. I made drastic changes in my diet and lifestyle. I follow the diet which can be found at: www.hacres.com. There is also a very good book by Anne Frohm (sp.?) called the "The Cancer Battle Plan". My best to you both. Teresa Hi Gary,   I was diagnosed last June 2006 with triple negative breast cancer. Like you, against my doctor's advise, I chose not to have chemo or radiation.  I had a lumpectomy for IDC no invasion of lymph nodes and felt it was not necessary to have chemo or radiation due to it being a low grade cancer and clear margins.  I followed a restricted diet with a good nutritionist and did every measure of prevention possible.  I went for my blood markers every 3 months followed by a MRI and every thing came out negative.  Now the shocker comes, I was experiencing Vertigo and having some very bad dizzy spells which the docs kept telling me was just Vertigo. They continued giving me Meclizine which helped but then it would come back.  I knew deep in my heart that something else had to be going down, so I asked my Oncologist to schedule a Pet Scan on my brain which gave me some very astonishing news.  I am now dealing with 2 brain tumors located at the left side of my cerebellum and 1 tumor located in my spinal cord at the T4 level.  Due to the tumor being located at my spinal cord, I have been in chronic pain with my left back and legs for the past month.  I am going blind doing research and have received more than 5 opinions.  My oncologist is highly suggesting TOMO Radiation therapy, from what I have read it delivers a very good measure of eliminating tumors on the spine, without receiving any awful side effects.  The surprising aspect about this whole issue was the case that if I didn't take the initiative to schedule the brain MRI I would have never known about these existing problems.  The oncologist do no tell women how high the rate is of breast cancer spreading to the brain.  My question to my Oncologist was:  If Breast Cancer has a high percentage of spreading to the brain, then why isn't a Brain Scan highly suggested after 1 year following breast surgery.  His answer was the cost which  is no excuse for neglect in this area.  My health is relatively excellent, I exercise and eat a very healthy diet, had all past and present negative reports in the last year,  and then to find out that my breast cancer metastises to my brain and spinal cord  is mind blowing. I am sending this message out so that women can demand brain scans once a year to protect their bodies after breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: Dear Gary, My mother has just been diagnosed with breast cancer and I have Alot of doubts about her getting radiation treatment as well. I have looked into naturopathic doctors in my area that may be of assisitance to us and to you. Please let me know how things turn out for you and your wife. God bless, Kevin
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: On 1/4/2007 Dogwalker wrote: I was recently diagnosed with Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma, stage 1. I had a lumpectomy surgery and the tumor was 1.5 centimeters. The tumor had not spread to surrounding tissue or the sentinal lymph nodes. However, the tumor was irregular in shape and I think that means that the cell activity could be active. It is my intention to go through radiation therapy and take Femara. My pathology slides were sent to be tested (oncotype DX) to see what the possibility is that the cancer could spread to other organs. The results came back in the intermediate area, which is the grey, unknown area. My oncologist recommends chemo (4 weeks). I am very reluctant to take chemo. I have a great sensitivity to drugs, and along with chemo he gives steroids. I got very ill with a virus for many months, when I took steriods for a foot problem. The virus went to my eyes (iritis) and I eventually lost the sight in the central part of my left eye which has completely changed my life, and not for the better. I don't feel my immune system can take all the toxicity. (I also have Gauchers Disease.) I told him I don't want chemo. My gut feeling is that I am correct. However, he said that with radiation and femara, I have an 85% chance that the cancer won't spread within a 10 yr. period. chemo improves that about 4%. I don't feel that 4% is worth taking a risk with my health condition. As I said, this is my gut feeling. I just don't want to start worrying that I made the wrong decision. Am I wrong to feel this way? I know there is no guarantee, but I think they are overdoing it, to be honest. Any guidelines would be helpful to me. I know this is a personal decision in the end and I take responsibility for it. Thanks, Dogwalker
Posts.Title: Difficult Personal Decision

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with Invasive Ductal Carcinoma on March 31, 2006.  When I received this shocking news I was on a roller coaster and could not think straight for months.  To make a long story short, I had two opinions and decided to go with the second surgeon who was extremely compassionate and well qualified to do the Lumpectomy.  On June 2, 2006 I had a Lumpectomy and a Sentinel Node Mapping to rule out any spread of cancer to the lymph nodes.  After surgery I was told that there was no spread to the nodes and that I was triple negative which means my estrogen, progesterone and HER-2Neu were Negative.  I was also Stage 1, Grade 1 with no lymph node involvement. My Oncologist suggested that I do Chemo and have radiation which I was dead against.  After hearing this news I took my time and researched every cancer network that I could get my hands on and decided against both radiation and chemo.  My Oncologist was not at all comfortable with my decision, but did respect the fact that I was not going to accept such deadly treatments when I was feeling perfectly fine.  My Oncologist and I both agreed that since I was not going to do Chemo and Radiation that I would be put on Observation whereby I would go to the Cancer Hospital every 3months and have a complete blood chemistry taken of my electrolites and markers.  I've been doing this since June 2, 2006 and all my blood test are totally fine with not a sign of any cancer.  I also just had a Mammogram and everything looked fine.  My Oncologist and Breast Surgeon are both amazed at my results and admire the fact that I had the courage  to follow my inner voice and trust my gut feelings.  I totally agree with you regarding your decision not to consider Chemo, it's like taking a sledge hammer to your body and the results are not always guaranteed anyway.  I also have educated myself to use Holistic Medicine and found a very good Vitamin called Indole -3-Carbinol also known as I3C by Metagenics which is a pharmaceutal grade vitamin.  I3C helps to produce the good estrogen and promotes healthy breast tissue.  You can order these vitamins on www.Luckyvitamins.com and read about it also.  I highly recommend this over taking any drugs regarding breast cancer. It sounds to me like your Oncologist is drug happy and just wants to follow the program which is not always the answer to every woman's diagnosis.  If you follow the pattern with women who have had Lumpectomy it's always the same menu, Chemo and Radiation, which is not always the answers to every women's treatment.  Please be proactive, read and get yourself to a good Naturopathic Doctor who can help you make much healthier decisions .  I hope this will influence you to make a safer and healthier decision. I feel wonderful and thank God that I had the brains to research and look for better modalities to keep my body healthy. If you need any further information, please write again.  Good luck-
Posts.Title: Difficult Personal Decision

Posts.Content: There is definitely way toooo much guessing here.  I highly suggest that you contact another Breast Surgeon who is well qualified and has records to proove otherwise.  The fact that your doctor told you not to worry about it and allow him to take care of it is not at all acceptable.  I would not consider doing a lumpectomy until I had at least 3 opinions.  Lumpectomies are being done way too much today when other treatments are possible.  Investigate your case as though it was your last day on earth, remember it's your body and your breast are yours forever.  Good luck
Posts.Title: new here with a question about lumpectomy's

Posts.Content: I was in the same situation as you after hearing all the horror stories regarding the injection which is applied so that the readio-active dye is inserted into the nipple for mapping results. I was anticipating the worst scenario only to find out it was a breeze. The most important question to ask you doctor before going into nuclear medicine is to have them apply a anti-numbing cream which will desenitize your nipple. This cream will numb the nipple area where the very fine needle will be applied. I had this procedure done on June 2, at Williamantic Hospital here in CT and the doctor who perform the nuclear mapping procedure was wonderful. As he inserted the needle after numbing me, his assistant held my hand and told me to take deep breaths, while I only felt stinging and before long it was all over. The nipple area will be blue for some time but, you feel nothing afterwards. I'll pray for you and hope that everything turns out fine. Good luck with the procedure.
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Have you considered intravenous vitamin C treatments? A naturopathic doctor that is qualified to administer it may be of great value. I am working with an integrative oncologist that specializes in cancer and brain tumors, her name is Jean Wallace. There is Alot more that you can do to help yourself than just chemo and radiation. I hope that this helps you and I wish you the best of luck!
Posts.Title: Metaplastic Breast Cancer has metasticized

Posts.Content: Based on your diagnois of IDC what matters now is how your markers were diagnosed.  Are your Estrogen Receptors Negative or Positive.  What is your Stage and Grade, this is also very, very, very, important in order to come up with what treatments you should consider, if any at all. I was also IDC Stage 1, Grade 1, Estrogen, Progesterone, Her-2 Neu Negative.  I did not do radiation or chemo but followed my Oncologist in Blood testing every quarter and I am as clean as a whistle.  Your bio-markers are very, very,  important.  You must educate yourself and sit down with your pathologist and oncologist and discuss these very important  markers..  Remember your the boss here, not your doctors.  Take charge and follow your wisdom and love your breast.
Posts.Title: Tough decision to make

Posts.Content: I highly recommend that you do not have a Bilateral Masectomy.  It will only make your immune system weaker and cause other unnecessary symptoms in your body. I also think that you should get yourself to a clinical therapist or someone who you can trust in relation to you having sooo many breast surgeries.  Just because you have lumps and cysts doesn't mean that you have to allow these doctors to cut you open and  remove them.  I have many lumps as well in my breast and I am 65 years old and never had one removed.  As long as your mammogram does not predict otherwise I would not give into the hysteria that I need them cut out.  Take a deep breath and try to relax about your breast, massage them, and love them and stop obsessing about them being cancerous.  Another word of advice is to stop talking to breast surgeons so frequently and think positive about your health.  Laugh, think positive and take up a hobby that will distract you from thinking about negativity. Good luck.
Posts.Title: PREVENTIVE BILATERAL MASECTIMY
